param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: POST
method.doc:
This web service will replace the current cluster configuration information with the specified values.
This will remove the current configuration and replace it with the values specified here.
Note: This web service can only be run on the node that is intended to be the primary master. The primary and secondary masters cannot both be modified in the same commit operation.

request.doc:
POST https://{appliance_hostname}/isam/cluster/v2 POST_DATA: { "primary_master":"1.1.1.1", "dsc_external_clients":"true", "dsc_port":"9000", "dsc_use_ssl":"false", "dsc_worker_threads":"30", "dsc_maximum_session_lifetime":"120", "dsc_client_grace_period":"30", "dsc_connection_idle_timeout":"10", "hvdb_embedded":false, "hvdb_db_type":"oracle", "hvdb_address":"192.168.93.110", "hvdb_port":"1521", "hvdb_user":"SYSTEM", "hvdb_password":"passw0rd", "hvdb_db_name":"ORCL", "hvdb_db_secure":true, "hvdb_db_truststore":"oracle_keys", "hvdb_driver_type":"thin", "cfgdb_embedded": true, "first_port":"10000", "cfgdb_fs":"false", }
External databases require different sets of parameters depending on the type of database. The following examples illustrate external runtime (HVDB) databases. To configure an external configuration database, replace the 'hvdb' prefix of the keys with 'cfgdb'.
External DB2 Database Definition The following keys define an external db2 runtime (HVDB) database: "hvdb_embedded": false, "hvdb_db_type": "db2", "hvdb_address": "db2.isam.ibm.com", "hvdb_port": "50009", "hvdb_db_secure": true, "hvdb_user": "isam_user", "hvdb_password": "hunter2", "hvdb_db_name": "isam_runtime",
Optionally, an additional server for HADR and ACR can be specified. "hvdb_db_alt": true, "hvdb_db2_alt_address": "db2-bak.isam.ibm.com", "hvdb_db2_alt_port": "50009",
External Oracle Database Definition The following keys define an external Oracle runtime (HVDB) database: "hvdb_embedded": false, "hvdb_db_type": "oracle", "hvdb_address": "oracle-rac.isam.ibm.com", "hvdb_port": "49001", "hvdb_user": "isam_user", "hvdb_password": "hunter2", "hvdb_db_name": "isam_runtime_db", "hvdb_driver_type": "thin", "hvdb_db_secure": false,
If secure db connection is "true" then a key store will be required which contains the trusted certificate of the Oracle DB "hvdb_db_truststore": "oracle_keys",
External postgresql Database Definition The following keys define an external postgresql runtime (HVDB) database: "hvdb_embedded": false, "hvdb_db_type": "postgresql", "hvdb_address": "postgresql.isam.ibm.com", "hvdb_port": "5432", "hvdb_db_secure": true, "hvdb_user": "isam_user", "hvdb_password": "hunter2", "hvdb_db_name": "isam_runtime", "hvdb_failover_servers": [ {"address":"secondary.pg.ibm.com", "port":5432 "order":1 }, {"address":"tertiary.pg.ibm.com", "port":5432 "order":2 } ]

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: primary_master
param.doc: The address (management interface) of the node that is acting as the primary master.

param.name: dsc_external_clients
param.doc: A flag true/false indicating whether clients that are external to the cluster will need to use the DSC.

param.name: dsc_port
param.doc: The port over which DSC communication will take place. This parameter is required if dsc_external_clients is set to true.

param.name: dsc_use_ssl
param.doc: A flag true/false indicating whether or not SSL should be used when communicating with the DSC. This parameter is required if dsc_external_clients is set to true. dsc_ssl_keyfile[String,Optional] The keyfile that will house the SSL certificates used by the DSC. This parameter is required if dsc_use_ssl is set to true.

param.name: dsc_ssl_label
param.doc: The name of the SSL certificate that will be presented to clients. This parameter is optional and can only be set if dsc_ssl_keyfile is set.

param.name: dsc_worker_threads
param.doc: The number of worker threads that will be used.

param.name: dsc_maximum_session_lifetime
param.doc: The maximum lifetime of sessions within the DSC.

param.name: dsc_client_grace_period
param.doc: When a client is shut down we give the client a grace period (in seconds) to restart and register an interest in a session again before we remove the session from the session cache. This will give the client a chance to restart without losing sessions from the server. The value specified here should be similar to the idle timeout value for the session.

param.name: dsc_connection_idle_timeout
param.doc: The maximum length of time that a connection from a client can remain idle before it is closed by the server. A value of 0 indicates that connections will not be reused. The default value is 0.

param.name: hvdb_embedded
param.doc: A flag true/false indicating whether or not the Runtime database (HVDB) is embedded (true) or external (false). If this value is true, the internal database will be used and none of the other hvdb_* values are required.

param.name: hvdb_max_size
param.doc: The percentage of currently available disk space which can be used for the embedded Runtime database. This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to true.

param.name: hvdb_db_type
param.doc: The type of database that is being used. Valid values are db2, postgresql and oracle. This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: hvdb_address
param.doc: The IP or hostname of the external database server. This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: hvdb_port
param.doc: The port on which the external database server is listening. This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: hvdb_user
param.doc: The administrator name for the external database. This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: hvdb_password
param.doc: The administrator password for the external database. This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: hvdb_db2_alt_address
param.doc: The IP or hostname of the fail-over server in DB2 HADR/ACR environments. (Can be specified for DB2 only). This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: hvdb_db2_alt_port
param.doc: The IP or hostname of the fail-over server in DB2 HADR/ACR environments. (Can be specified for DB2 only). This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: hvdb_db_name
param.doc: The name of the external database (Required for DB2, PostgreSQL and Oracle). This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: hvdb_db_secure
param.doc: A flag true/false indicating whether or not the external database is secure. (Required for DB2, PostgreSQL and Oracle). This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: hvdb_db_truststore
param.doc: The SSL Key Store which contains the trusted certificate of the Oracle DB requiring secure connectivity. (Required for Oracle only when hvdb_db_secure is true)

param.name: hvdb_driver_type
param.doc: The type of Oracle JDBC driver to use. (Required for Oracle only). This option is only valid if hvdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: hvdb_failover_servers
param.doc: An ordered list of PostgreSQL failover servers for the Runtime database. (Can be specified for PostgreSQL only).

param.name: cfgdb_embedded
param.doc: A flag true/false indicating whether or not the Configuration database is embedded (true) or external (false). If this value is not specified, the internal database will be used and none of the other cfgdb_* values are required.

param.name: cfgdb_db_type
param.doc: The type of database that is being used. Valid values are db2, postgresql and oracle. This option is only valid if cfgdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: cfgdb_address
param.doc: The IP or hostname of the external database server. This option is only valid if cfgdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: cfgdb_port
param.doc: The port on which the external database server is listening. This option is only valid if cfgdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: cfgdb_user
param.doc: The administrator name for the external database. This option is only valid if cfgdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: cfgdb_password
param.doc: The administrator password for the external database. This option is only valid if cfgdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: cfgdb_db2_alt_address
param.doc: The IP or hostname of the fail-over server in DB2 HADR/ACR environments. (Can be specified for DB2 only). This option is only valid if cfgdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: cfgdb_db2_alt_port
param.doc: The IP or hostname of the fail-over server in DB2 HADR/ACR environments. (Can be specified for DB2 only). This option is only valid if cfgdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: cfgdb_db_name
param.doc: The name of the external database (Required for DB2, PostgreSQL and Oracle). This option is only valid if cfgdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: cfgdb_db_secure
param.doc: A flag true/false indicating whether or not the external database is secure. (Required for DB2, PostgreSQL and Oracle). This option is only valid if cfgdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: cfgdb_db_truststore
param.doc: The SSL Key Store which contains the trusted certificate of the Oracle DB requiring secure connectivity. (Required for Oracle only when cfgdb_db_secure is true)

param.name: cfgdb_driver_type
param.doc: The type of Oracle JDBC driver to use. (Required for Oracle only). This option is only valid if cfgdb_embedded is set to false.

param.name: cfgdb_failover_servers
param.doc: An ordered list of PostgreSQL failover servers for the Configuration database. (Can be specified for PostgreSQL only).

param.name: first_port
param.doc: A port number that is the first in a range of 30 ports that will be reserved for use by the cluster web services.

param.name: cfgdb_fs
param.doc: A flag true/false indicating whether to use the external Configuration database as an alternate method to share internal files among the cluster. Using this method enables many configuration items to be changed on a non-Primary node when the Primary node is offline.

param.name: address
param.doc: The IP addess or hostname of the failover server.

param.name: port
param.doc: The port of the failover server.

param.name: order
param.doc: The order of the failover server. This will be used to indicate the order in which the array of failover servers will be configured in the JDBC settings.
